title: Pirate looking typography.. arrr matee..
content:
hi. i am designing a board game that has to do with pirates.. and that time period... does anyone have any type suggestions?

thanks!
author: misslaloki

comments.content: Yes, apparently Dave Nalle's fonts were used in the material/logo for the Pirates of the Caribbean movies. Of Myfonts other piratey fonts - [http://www.myfonts.com/browse/keyword/pirate/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413024540/http:/www.myfonts.com/browse/keyword/pirate/ "http://www.myfonts.com/browse/keyword/pirate/") I like "Dead Mans Chest"

"Yes, apparently Dave Nalle’s fonts were used in the material/logo for the Pirates of the Caribbean movies."

Oh... that's where I have seen it... Not a good idea using them in a board game about pirates then.

These aren't "pirate fonts" per se, but could do well to evoke that old worlde feel. Maybe some of these for body copy/small text.

[http://www.mvbfonts.com/html/fonts/chanson/pk\_chanson.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413024540/http:/www.mvbfonts.com/html/fonts/chanson/pk_chanson.htm "http://www.mvbfonts.com/html/fonts/chanson/pk\_chanson.htm")

[http://www.mvbfonts.com/html/fonts/gryphius/pk\_gryphius.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413024540/http:/www.mvbfonts.com/html/fonts/gryphius/pk_gryphius.htm "http://www.mvbfonts.com/html/fonts/gryphius/pk\_gryphius.htm")

[http://www.mvbfonts.com/html/fonts/celestia/pk\_celestia\_one.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413024540/http:/www.mvbfonts.com/html/fonts/celestia/pk_celestia_one.htm "http://www.mvbfonts.com/html/fonts/celestia/pk\_celestia\_one.htm")

[http://www.mvbfonts.com/html/fonts/sirenne/pk\_sirenne\_six.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413024540/http:/www.mvbfonts.com/html/fonts/sirenne/pk_sirenne_six.htm "http://www.mvbfonts.com/html/fonts/sirenne/pk\_sirenne\_six.htm")

perhaps you can license [Rapscallion](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413024540/http:/chank.com/freefont_detail.php?sku=1077) for your purposes.  
Of if you want to give the kids classy, instead of cute, you might try [Incognito](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413024540/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/incognito.asp), which was inspired by lettering on maps.

Oddly enough, about a year ago, I was doing some informal researching into "Pirate" looking typefaces and scripts for a children's poster mock-up. David Nalle's site does have several candidates besides Captain Kidd (he has a [great web page](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413024540/http:/www.fontcraft.com/scriptorium/kidd/index.html) on the inspiration and development of the face).

You can also find many "historic" styled faces available at [The Walden Font Co.](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413024540/http:/www.waldenfont.com/). By mixing a titling face and "handwritten" lines here and there, you can emulate an "old treasure map" look. Look at their "Divers Handes" collection for scripts.

FYI- you might contact them direct since they seem to be working on a new "Nautical Themes" collection. Maybe you can be one of the first users and be truly unique with your project.

Did you see Type Oasis [Pirate & Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413024540/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/pirates/index.htm) yet?

\>Oh… that’s where I have seen it… Not a good idea using them in a board game about pirates then.

Quick mockup for the new Disney/Pixar/Apple promo for the movie...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413024540im_/http:/typophile.com/files/piratey.jpg)

LOL i love it.

Everyone just looked at me because I LOLed so loud.

Seems like a perfect use of the gorgeous [Olduvai](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413024540/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000054).

--Michael.

[Terranova](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413024540/http:/typophile.com/node/15535)-- seen in the Critique section -- a work in progress but pretty far along, and the designer might let you to take it for a spin.  
For really baaad pirates, [FF Merlin.](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413024540/http:/www.philsfonts.com/showing.html?sku=FF010998X1P1&start=1)

"Terranova — seen in the Critique section — a work in progress but pretty far along, and the designer might let you to take it for a spin."

:) I was just thinking "could Terra Nova be a pirate font?", and i came to the conclusion: it could. I just don't know yet whether it's applicable already in professional use, but I'll put an update there the next minutes, so you can have a look at it.  
Possible problems: No bold, no italic, maybe too filigree, and never been used in productive systems yet.  
Possible pros: made from a map of america from 1561 (spaniard), has titling capitals, lots of special characters (astrological, astronomical, roman numbers, ligatures, etc.).  
If you want to use it, I could produce a version with merged contours and send it to you for a try.

Sebilar
